answers.answer: Get evaluated asap. This could be so many issues from mild to dangerous.

You need to make an appointment with a neurologist. What you are describing sounds like what is called Wernicke's aphasia. It is a condition which a person either partial or total loses of the ability to understand what is being said or read.

i dont if i fall under the disease you mentioned..i have no problem with my speech..well only that there were times where i had to cut my speech cause i was suddenly blank..i knew what i wanted to say but couldn't spill it out..today i had a headache the whole day..not severe but i could still feel it..and my hands now feel weak..when i tried to hold a pen to write..it felt so weird and weak..and i had to write it slowly and noticed that the words did not look the same as before (meaning i wrote the words big and slow)i already made an appointment but it is set in may..it drives me crazy and affects my work badly

You need an MRA and an MRI as of yesterday. While it is true that you have developed asphagia there are many different etiologies. Degenerative brain disease is one possibility, however the sudden onset suggests "STROKE" in large capital letters. And I suspect stroke from a slow bleed that is getting progressively worse,.Forget about "an appointment". You need an IMMEDIATE evaluation. Head for an ER.

i dont know..now it seems that i'm slightly recovered where i can understand but it takes slowly..better than before..does this(symptoms of stroke perhaps) happen all the time or only at certain times?
Go to an ER, for goodness sakes!You have the hallmark symptoms of a stroke.If you have a bleed you may end up incontinent, blind or paralyzed for the rest of your life.
sorry..it's just because i check the stroke symptoms and mine are just mild..that's why i thought it would sound paranoid if i go to er..if this happens again i would definitely take it serious

Why do you care what the doctors and nurses think. You know that you have a medical problem that needs to be addressed. What is the worst that can happen? Them telling you that it is not a stroke. So what.If it is not a stroke then the doctor's can at least point you in the right direction, or even tell you what is going on.Don't worry about what someone you don't even know thinks about you and just go get checked out. If it happens again you might be to late to take it serious.  Just go and get checked out.

If you decide not to go to the ER, at least book an urgent appointment to see your doctor.Symptoms that you describe can sometimes be from lack of sleep for a few days, and also form a urinary infection.  Observe and look at your urine. Urinate into a clear glass jar so that you can see what it looks like.A cloudy urine may mean that you have an infection.  A dark urine may mean there may be visible blood or that you are dehydrated.  A urine that smells very strongly may too be an infection.Make sure that you do not get dehydrated, because that will make you feel unwell.  2 litres of water a day is usually recommended, but more if you sweat a lot.Severe depression, stress and anxiety can cause similar problems, even though you may think that you are fine you still may have any one these problems.  I presume that no one has "spiked" any of your drinks!Ensure that you get sleep every night and have a good sleep hygiene.Have a healthy and well balanced diet with lots of fresh fruit and vegetables, lean meat, fish.  Don't eat large portions at once, but smaller meals with a healthy snack in between.If your sugar levels drop, that can make you feel unwell too.  Pre diabetes and diabetes  don't always have any symptoms.Don't forget to book an appointment to see your doctor to get checked out.Let me know how you get on.Best wishes.

thank you..i have no problem with my sleeping..i sleep well every night and sometimes i guess i sleep a lot..now i can read and understand..just that sometimes i still have headache..1 week ago, i check my blood pressure 123/78..so its considered good righti'm just waiting for it to happen again..so as to convince me that something is wrong..if not then i guest maybe i'm just stress

question: I'm currently having problem reading and understand things..It happened 2 weeks ago and initially i wasn't really paid attention to it but now i realized that something is just wrong..When I try to read something (be it for my study or normal readings), i feel that i don't understand anything..the words that i read just passed like that it can't remember what i just read..well, i got the bit and pieces but overall i'm unable to process and think..it takes me a long time to read 1 page and i re-read it for so many times but the information is not stored in my brain..even when someone speaks in front of class, i can't pay attention at all. Suddenly it feels so hard for me to connect the words and understand the overall speech..Sometimes, i feel like there's a pressure in my head..it feels heavy and like something is pushing it. People are saying that I'm just stress out and need a break but I'm not! I mean there's nothing for me to stress out..
title: Inability to understand
